contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Zoë Weizenbaum | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1991|9|21}} | birth_place = [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]], [[United States|U.S.]] | occupation = Actress | years_active= 2005–2008 | tradchinesename = [[王秋麗]] | simpchinesename = [[王秋丽]] | pinyinchinesename = wángqiūlì }} '''Zoë Weizenbaum''' (Chinese: 王秋麗; born September 21, 1991) is a former [[United States|American]] actress. ==Biography== ===Early life=== Weizenbaum was born in [[Seattle, Washington]] to an American mother and a [[China|Chinese]] father. From the age of two, she grew up in [[Amherst, Massachusetts]]. For years, [[African Dance]] was her primary love. She also enjoyed being part of Amherst's local musical theatre productions. ===Career=== She was called for an audition for ''[[Missing in America]]'' after someone saw her perform in a local production of ''[[Peter Pan]]''. Since finishing this movie, she has also had principal roles in ''[[12 and Holding]]'', directed by [[Michael Cuesta]], and in ''[[Memoirs of a Geisha (film)|Memoirs of a Geisha]]'', directed by [[Rob Marshall]]. ===Personal life=== Weizenbaum attended Amherst Regional High School for her freshman year, before she decided to return to [[Pioneer Valley Performing Arts Charter Public School]] where she went to middle school and is currently a student. Zoe can speak [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]], learning through the [[Rosetta Stone]] program as well as enrolling in intensive Chinese courses at [[Mount Holyoke College]] and [[Middlebury College's Summer Intensive Language Program]]. From 2010-2011, Zoe attended [[Middlebury College]] and is currently studying Japanese. She now attends [[Mount Holyoke College]] in South Hadley, MA. She is the granddaughter of [[computer science|computer scientist]], [[Joseph Weizenbaum]] (1923-2008). ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.nowplayingmag.com/content/view/3842/62/ Interview with the cast of "Twelve and Holding"] - ''Now Playing magazine'' * {{IMDb name|1494624}} * [http://www.ilmarefilm.org/W_E_1.htm "Weizenbaum. Rebel at Work." a documentary film about Joseph Weizenbaum, Zoe Weizenbaum's Grandfather.] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Weizenbaum, Zoë | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American actor | DATE OF BIRTH =September 21, 1991 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]], [[United States|U.S.]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Weizenbaum, Zoe}} [[Category:1991 births]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American people of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Amherst, Massachusetts]] [[Category:People from Seattle, Washington]] [[Category:Actresses from Washington (state)]] [[Category:Mount Holyoke College alumni]] {{US-film-actor-1990s-stub}}
